documents.document: The best time to make friends is before you need them. - Ethel Barrymore http://t.co/5GdM5jrJo4
Enjoy today's featured quote by Saint Francis de Sales! http://t.co/J5tcwoVVjc
Have patience with all things, But, first of all with yourself. - Saint Francis de Sales http://t.co/wHNuDQz22B
Enjoy today's featured quote by Euripides! http://t.co/wFYrhWD2DB
One loyal friend is worth ten thousand relatives. - Euripides http://t.co/zATQZqLig3
Enjoy today's featured quote by George MacDonald! http://t.co/hJgiWE2gDq
Few delights can equal the presence of one whom we trust utterly. - George MacDonald http://t.co/ymuS4Wfexc
Enjoy today's featured quote by Mignon McLaughlin! http://t.co/pp47cIcCi7
Learning too soon our limitations, we never learn our powers. - Mignon McLaughlin http://t.co/TK3Zd8cbDs
Enjoy today's featured quote by Martin Luther! http://t.co/vwoOYbVZ8l
Even if I knew that tomorrow the world would go to pieces, I would still plant my apple tree. - Martin Luther http://t.co/rbeUjlnINK
Enjoy today's featured quote by Swami Sivananda! http://t.co/jEVoZJKH7s
Put your heart, mind, and soul into even your smallest acts. This is the secret of success. - Swami Sivananda http://t.co/7MwGRFZZVt
Enjoy today's featured quote by Mencius! http://t.co/aCMW2M25Wd
Sincerity is the way to heaven. - Mencius http://t.co/UOjlPnYKAw
Enjoy today's featured quote by Martin Farquhar Tupper! http://t.co/b9jqKN8MVU
Well-timed silence hath more eloquence than speech. - Martin Farquhar Tupper http://t.co/fM7SOsUHwg
Enjoy today's featured quote by E. W. Howe! http://t.co/tTvvGPU2hl
Instead of loving your enemies - treat your friends a little better. - E. W. Howe http://t.co/LJKlG5tQt6
Enjoy today's featured quote by Clarence Day! http://t.co/9M8jXL0bwV
Information's pretty thin stuff unless mixed with experience. - Clarence Day http://t.co/kteRewQxTz
Enjoy today's featured quote by Richard Cecil! http://t.co/SbRZvrWSWZ
The first step towards knowledge is to know that we are ignorant. - Richard Cecil http://t.co/oW2wF9cNx1
Enjoy today's featured quote by Andrew Carnegie! http://t.co/ancuKWAA8U
Do your duty and a little more and the future will take care of itself. - Andrew Carnegie http://t.co/rlYB3EoTGa
Enjoy today's featured quote by Mary Wortley Montagu! http://t.co/opmFOFQQX4
Civility costs nothing, and buys everything. - Mary Wortley Montagu http://t.co/HtAeKervTZ
Enjoy today's featured quote by Will Durant! http://t.co/BMffIRbhL6
To say nothing, especially when speaking, is half the art of diplomacy. - Will Durant http://t.co/NHOxwqtawL
Enjoy today's featured quote by Frank B. Kellogg! http://t.co/cWjBS4ewjx
It is not to be expected that human nature will change in a day. - Frank B. Kellogg http://t.co/dFHHnoBCgV
Enjoy today's featured quote by Epictetus! http://t.co/vTmfyuItr0
Is freedom anything else than the right to live as we wish? Nothing else. - Epictetus http://t.co/3p5D3gaUmX
Enjoy today's featured quote by Norman Cousins! http://t.co/Gheg2IGaP5
If something comes to life in others because of you, then you have made an approach to immortality. - Norman Cousins
@BrainyQuote Happy Birthday, Leo Tolstoy!
Everyone thinks of changing the world, but no one thinks of changing himself. - Leo Tolstoy http://t.co/bCRwMg1YdQ
Enjoy today's featured quote by William Howard Taft! http://t.co/mzJUssrmhm
Enthusiasm for a cause sometimes warps judgment. - William Howard Taft http://t.co/oF34mWQQKH
Enjoy today's featured quote by Augustine of Hippo! http://t.co/TgatfGEofo
Habit, if not resisted, soon becomes necessity. - Augustine of Hippo http://t.co/EdHEC0u9TV
Enjoy today's featured quote by Pietro Aretino! http://t.co/qMI4yGKCbW
I am, indeed, a king, because I know how to rule myself. - Pietro Aretino http://t.co/0ODB0Uw6Uq
Enjoy today's featured quote by Robert Hall! http://t.co/UY0GsjIBwv
In matters of conscience, first thoughts are best. In matters of prudence, last thoughts are best. - Robert Hall http://t.co/FArk6BbosL
Enjoy today's featured quote by Edward Everett Hale! http://t.co/4hnFYqTCIF
The making of friends who are real friends, is the best token we have of a man's success in life. Edward Everett Hale http://t.co/uIiWflbaai
Enjoy today's featured quote by William Arthur Ward! http://t.co/ZsGXA280iM
The pessimist complains about the wind; the optimist expects it to change; the realist adjusts the sails. - William Arthur Ward
Enjoy today's featured quote by Thomas J. Watson! http://t.co/wZHqEPKAG8
If you want to increase your success rate, double your failure rate. - Thomas J. Watson http://t.co/nQi7UXVG1j
Enjoy today's featured quote by Aristotle! http://t.co/jXGYZsZIMH
The energy of the mind is the essence of life. - Aristotle http://t.co/HaVHxM7aLz
Enjoy today's featured quote by John Galsworthy! http://t.co/17HjtQfFpb
Love has no age, no limit; and no death. - John Galsworthy http://t.co/T7elrcHD56
Enjoy today's featured quote by Edna St. Vincent Millay! http://t.co/W5FLXL8TFu
The soul can split the sky in two and let the face of God shine through. - Edna St. Vincent Millay http://t.co/MTF5CFOMdI
Enjoy today's featured quote by Pierre Teilhard de Chardin! http://t.co/8Y7uDKi4rw http://t.co/8b1vzlWzpd
It is our duty as men and women to proceed as though the limits of our abilities do not exist. - Pierre Teilhard de Chardin
Enjoy today's featured quote by Francesco Guicciardini! http://t.co/XrcsSAzaHc
Since there is nothing so well worth having as friends, never lose a chance to make them. - Francesco Guicciardini http://t.co/QAd5jI5jgf
While we are postponing, life speeds by. - Lucius Annaeus Seneca https://t.co/BFHspduAfc #brainyquote #QOTD #life https://t.co/APqRKVymwK
We have two ears and one mouth so that we can listen twice as much as we speak. https://t.co/gCb8HqErCC #brainyquote https://t.co/nr8CS6wCHL
Your sacred space is where you can find yourself again and again. - Joseph Campbell #wisdom http://t.co/n2lQEbDdsn http://t.co/jr39TXzfHV
No matter how busy you are, you must take time to make the other person feel important. http://t.co/OByHht66d1 http://t.co/wrpthhhuvw
Enjoy today's featured quote by Laurence J. Peter! http://t.co/HJ3AgkKMim
Don't believe in miracles - depend on them. - Laurence J. Peter http://t.co/JFps06Yy3n
Humanity has won its battle. Liberty now has a country. - Lafayette http://t.co/92LdwxkSL1 #HappyBastilleDay http://t.co/hXt6ylgYON
From my tribe I take nothing, I am the maker of my own fortune. - Tecumseh http://t.co/FW42PND0ll #success #QOTD http://t.co/WCVxeApo0C
Life is not a problem to be solved, but a reality to be experienced. - Soren Kierkegaard http://t.co/IVPCwBATQv http://t.co/rdJoJfIZik
The art of being wise is the art of knowing what to overlook. - William James http://t.co/kK3SYwtmQl #wisdom http://t.co/AjS3UmN1vc
I came, I saw, I conquered. - Julius Caesar http://t.co/8WBNSkSbV5 #quoteoftheday http://t.co/vCGA14I21L
Think for yourselves and let others enjoy the privilege to do so, too. - Voltaire http://t.co/GaKAM8lVde #QOTD http://t.co/k5am0FoMG0
Your heart is full of fertile seeds, waiting to sprout. - Morihei Ueshiba http://t.co/bBK9Kl9GHl http://t.co/ElxMr5MTAQ
Joy is the simplest form of gratitude. - Karl Barth http://t.co/pCmCyx5O50 http://t.co/gRhy4HNGoZ
Without craftsmanship, inspiration is a mere reed shaken in the wind. - Johannes Brahms http://t.co/wvI9BQACgn http://t.co/DMdSKbFCl7
The real problem is not whether machines think but whether men do. - B. F. Skinner http://t.co/qBrgxeD3ja http://t.co/GSn3oPJYJG
Those who stand for nothing fall for anything. - Alexander Hamilton http://t.co/x4RysgMiI0 http://t.co/fTV11yYjER
Life comes from physical survival; but the good life comes from what we care about. Rollo May http://t.co/O2ggErp9l1 http://t.co/f4sS6EmrW9
@BrainyQuote Happy Thanksgiving to all those celebrating today!
I'm thankful for every moment. - Al Green http://t.co/xBO39CFaVW http://t.co/LIiqjIHDgc
It takes one person to forgive, it takes two people to be reunited. - Lewis B. Smedes http://t.co/FuVMRfHMdd http://t.co/nWhQoh5q1x
The hardest years in life are those between ten and seventy. - Helen Hayes http://t.co/JQQMytnUos http://t.co/O74a3sHFSU
Beauty is whatever gives joy. - Edna St. Vincent Millay http://t.co/JGnxnAOV63 http://t.co/Y5gn6jrIkD
